plugins.name: FlowConnect - Figjam Connectors in Figma
plugins.description:
FlowConnect: Connectors that are smart and seamless


FlowConnect brings Figjam-style connectors to Figma, making it easy to link frames and create flows. With smart positioning that automatically adjusts when you move elements, customizable arrow styles, and simple text labels, you can quickly create clean user flows and sitemaps. Connect your frames with just a few clicks and let FlowConnect handle the rest.


Key Features :


✦ Figjam-style connectors: Create connections between frames with real-time visual feedback

✦ Smart positioning: Connectors find the best connection points and auto-reroute when frames move

✦ Advanced styling options: Customize line types, stroke weights, dash patterns, and opacity

✦ Text labels: Add descriptive text to your connections that update automatically

✦ Live preview: See how your connections will look before you create them

✦ Multiple arrow styles: Choose from lines, triangles, diamonds, and circles for both connector ends

✦ Offset controls: Fine-tune connection points for perfect placement along frame edges


Premium Features :


✦ Custom Color Connectors

✦ Shapes - Future

✦ Set Presets

✦ More on the Roadmap.


How to use :

  1. Connecter is Pre copied already, You can just Ctrl/Cmd + V in you canvas to get started, If no press the copy button on top and paste them in canvas [One time Thing].
  2. Select any two objects and click Link objects to connect them using a connector styled according to your preferences.

accepted.name: Briston
accepted.description: Designer | Student | webflow

plugins.tagline: Connectors that are smart and seamless

a,b,c...

plugins.name: Layout - Tailwind CSS V4 Import & Export
plugins.description:
Layout is a powerful Figma plugin that transforms your design tokens into Tailwind CSS V4 compatible variables with just a few clicks. It creates a perfect bridge between your design system and development workflow.


Key Features:


  1. Import CSS Variables: Easily import existing CSS variables into Figma as design tokens
  2. Export to Tailwind CSS V4: Generate Tailwind CSS V4 compatible theme files from your Figma variables
  3. One-Click Tailwind Colors: Instantly add the complete Tailwind color palette to your Figma project
  4. Smart Variable Handling: Automatically processes color, typography, spacing, and shadow variables
  5. Preview Before Import: See exactly what variables will be created before importing them
  6. Intelligent Prefix Management: Automatically handles variable prefixes to ensure clean, consistent naming


Perfect For:

  1. Design teams working with developers using Tailwind CSS
  2. Creating and maintaining design systems
  3. Ensuring design-to-code consistency
  4. Streamlining the handoff process between design and development


Layout eliminates the tedious manual work of translating design tokens between Figma and code, saving you time and reducing errors. Keep your design system and code in perfect sync with this essential tool for modern design workflows.
plugins.tagline: Bridge Figma design tokens to the Tailwind CSS V4 config for perfect design-to-code harmony

plugins.name: Lucide Icons Importer from GitHub
plugins.description:
This plugin allows the user to import always the latest release of Lucide Icons directly from the official Lucide GitHub Repository.


Few steps for the best Lucide Icons experience:


  1. ⬆ - Available Folders to analize the Lucide repo and obtain only the folders where svg files are in.
  2. 🗂️ - Select the folder to import. I suggest "/icons" to get the main icons library.
  3. 𑿿 - Select the Icon Name Option between original name or with prefix.
  4. 🎛️ - Set Icon Size, Stroke Width, Color and, if you want test it through the WCAG Contrast Checker.
  5. 🪄 - Import the SVGs and wait for the magic.


Most important info:

  1. If you do your second icon import, the plugin will not replace your current library but will only check for differences and integrate the new icons. This way your projects will always be safe from unpleasant surprises ;)
  2. If the icon configuration is different from the one already present in your figma project, a new frame will be created to not overwrite other configurations.



* Let me know your feedback or bugfix requests. *
plugins.tagline: Import always the latest version of Lucide Icons

plugins.name: Custom Text Linter
plugins.description:
カスタム可能な用語一覧を元にテキストをチェックします。


テキストチェックの方法

  1. Figma、FigJam、Figma Slides 内でチェックしたいページを開きます。
  2. プラグインを起動し「ページをチェック」を押します。
  3. チェック結果が表示され、非推奨用語が含まれているレイヤーのリストが確認できます。
  4. 問題のある用語をクリックすると、該当するテキストレイヤーにフォーカスします。


用語一覧の更新方法

  1. 用語一覧を更新したい場合は「用語一覧の更新」 セクションを展開します。
  2. 用語一覧のCSVファイルを選択し、「CSVファイルをインポート」ボタンを押します。
  3. CSVには以下の列を含めます。
  4. recommended: 推奨される用語 （カンマ区切り）
  5. deprecated: 避けるべき用語 （カンマ区切り）
  6. message: 用語についての説明
  7. url: 参照リンク（任意）
  8. インポートが成功すると、ファイル名と日付が更新されます。


----


Checks text using a customizable term list.


How to Check Text

  1. Open the page you want to check in Figma, FigJam, or Figma Slides.
  2. Launch the plugin and click the “Check this page” button.
  3. The check results will be displayed, showing a list of text layers containing deprecated terms.
  4. Clicking on a flagged term will automatically focus on the corresponding text layer in the Figma page.


How to Update the Terms List

  1. If you want to update the terms list, expand the “Update Terms” section.
  2. Click the “Import CSV” button and select a CSV file containing the updated terms list.
  3. The CSV file should include the following columns:
  4. recommended: Preferred terms
  5. deprecated: Terms to avoid
  6. message: Explanation or corrective action
  7. url: Reference link (optional)
  8. Once the import is successful, the file name and date will be updated.

accepted.name: Shingo Suzuki
accepted.description:
Lead Designer / Interaction Designer
TSUMIKI INC.

plugins.tagline: Checks text using a customizable term list.

plugins.name: Decision Trackr
plugins.description:
No more meetings to debate decisions that have been made already.


Decision Trackr is a plugin that helps design teams capture, document, and review critical design decisions directly within their Figma projects. Select an element, log a decision and maintain a chronological version history of decisions made per element.


How to use it:

  1. Select the element to attach to your decision.
  2. Enter the decision and a reason.
  3. Add decision makers.
  4. Log your decision! 🚀


A decision history page is created and all decisions are properly versioned and link directly to the element relating to the decision.


Key Features:


Link Decisions to Elements: Decision Trackr lets users attach design decisions directly to elements within a Figma file. This makes it easy to understand the rationale behind each design component and offers context to anyone viewing the file.


Decision History and Versioning: Each decision can be updated and versioned, providing a chronological record of changes and their respective contexts. This historical view is invaluable for teams who may revisit past iterations or need to understand how and why certain design choices were made.


Decision ownership: Tag each decision with attendees or decision-maker's names. Each name is recorded and assigned to a decision. When ownership of a decision is clear, design jams become a place for robust and productive debate.


This plugin is a must-have for teams who like to own their work, make clear decisions and talk about the right things in meetings. No more meetings to debate decisions that have been made already.

accepted.name: Nic Haralambous
accepted.description: product builder, obsessive entrepreneur.

plugins.tagline: Quickly log, review, and manage design decisions within your Figma files.

plugins.name: Variables export to Gitlab
plugins.description:
Figma Variables Export Plugin Instruction


The Figma Variables plugin was developed to convert Figma Variables into SASS variables. 

To use this plugin you should have some Local variables in your Figma project


The plugin has 2 features:

  1. Export file with SASS variables in .scss format
  2. Publish file with SASS variables into Gitlab and create a merge request


Export file with SASS variables in .scss format

For exporting Figma Local Variables as SASS variables you just need to click the Export button


By clicking on the ‘Export’ button the file with .scss extension will be created. It will contain all Figma local variables in SASS format.


This file can be used in the UI project that uses SASS variables. After any changes in Figma Local Variables all is needed is just to make export of variables into the project directory again and the state of Local Variables will be synchronized with the state of SASS variables in the UI project.


Publish file with SASS variables into Gitlab and create a merge request

This feature is more advanced. It suggests that SASS variables are placed in some file that is stored in a Gitlab repository. For using this feature we need to set our Gitlab settings:


  1. Gitlab Domain (gitlab.com or another)
  2. Gitlab Token (user can get it from Gitlab settings)
  3. Target branch where you should create a merge request with changes
  4. Path to file with variables (i.e. src/variables.scss)
  5. Project Id (user can see it on gitlab project's page)


By clicking on Publish button the plugin performs the next steps:

  1. Creates new branch for updates
  2. Editing the .scss file from the File Path input
  3. Creates a merge request with changes in this file from just created branch into the Target Branch


After that a person who has permissions of merging can open Gitlab, check changes and merge them.


This feature makes UI project synchronization with Figma mockups more seamless and stable. After making any changes in Figma variables, UX Designer needs only click the Publish button, and UI developer needs only check these changes in Gitlab and click Merge Changes button.
plugins.tagline: Export Figma variables to .scss file of push them to file in Gitlab repository

71838.name: Variables export to Gitlab
71838.description:
Figma Variables Export Plugin Instruction


The Figma Variables plugin was developed to convert Figma Variables into SASS variables. 

To use this plugin you should have some Local variables in your Figma project


The plugin has 2 features:

  1. Export file with SASS variables in .scss format
  2. Publish file with SASS variables into Gitlab and create a merge request


Export file with SASS variables in .scss format

For exporting Figma Local Variables as SASS variables you just need to click the Export button


By clicking on the ‘Export’ button the file with .scss extension will be created. It will contain all Figma local variables in SASS format.


This file can be used in the UI project that uses SASS variables. After any changes in Figma Local Variables all is needed is just to make export of variables into the project directory again and the state of Local Variables will be synchronized with the state of SASS variables in the UI project.


Publish file with SASS variables into Gitlab and create a merge request

This feature is more advanced. It suggests that SASS variables are placed in some file that is stored in a Gitlab repository. For using this feature we need to set our Gitlab settings:


  1. Gitlab Domain (gitlab.com or another)
  2. Gitlab Token (user can get it from Gitlab settings)
  3. Target branch where you should create a merge request with changes
  4. Path to file with variables (i.e. src/variables.scss)
  5. Project Id (user can see it on gitlab project's page)


By clicking on Publish button the plugin performs the next steps:

  1. Creates new branch for updates
  2. Editing the .scss file from the File Path input
  3. Creates a merge request with changes in this file from just created branch into the Target Branch


After that a person who has permissions of merging can open Gitlab, check changes and merge them.


This feature makes UI project synchronization with Figma mockups more seamless and stable. After making any changes in Figma variables, UX Designer needs only click the Publish button, and UI developer needs only check these changes in Gitlab and click Merge Changes button.

networkAccess.reasoning: Should support publish to any git repository

plugins.description:
日本語ver.

何ができる？

ファイル内のコンポーネントを多い順に並べてCSVに出力できる。

以下の時に便利。

  1. 再利用の多いコンポーネントから順番に実装したい
  2. 利用数の多いコンポーネントから改善優先度を考えたい


使い方

  1. コンポーネントを数えたいファイルに移動
  2. プラグインを起動
  3. PC のダウンローダーから csv ファイルをダウンロード


あまり全力で保守していませんので、お手柔らかに。

要望はコメントください👍

by ふるじゅん


English ver.

What can it do?

It can output to CSV in order of the number of components in a file.

This is useful in the following cases,


  1. You want to implement components in order of most frequently reused components.
  2. To consider the priority of improvement from the component with the highest number of use.


How to use

  1. Move to the file where you want to count components
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Download the csv file from the downloader on your PC


We don’t do our best to maintain it very well, so please be easy on us. Please comment on any requests 👍

by Furujun

plugins.name: Bezier Palette Studio
plugins.description:
Transform your design workflow with this intuitive color palette generator that creates harmonious and accessible color scales. Using advanced HSV color mapping and Bézier curves, this plugin helps you generate professional color palettes.


Key Features:

  1. Effortless Palette Generation
  2. Auto Naming: Generate intuitive color names automatically based on hue values, ensuring consistency and saving time.
  3. Customizable Steps: Choose the exact number of shades per swatch to suit your project needs.
  4. Powerful Bézier Curve Control
  5. Interactive Curve Editor: Adjust color transitions using an intuitive Bézier curve interface integrated with an HSV color picker for unprecedented accuracy.
  6. Predefined and Customizable Curves: Pick from pre-made curves or switch to free-hand mode for full creative freedom.
  7. Accessibility
  8. Contrast Ratio Analysis: Automatically assess each color's contrast ratio against black and white backgrounds to ensure accessibility compliance.
  9. Color Tokens: Assign unique identifiers to every shade for hassle-free referencing across your designs.
  10. Seamless Integration and Export
  11. Export Color Tokens: Export your palette as JSON tokens for integration into your design systems or development workflows.
  12. Figma Frame Export: Instantly export palettes as organized frames within the current page of your Figma file for easy sharing and collaboration.
  13. Style Creation: Create reusable styles directly in your Figma file with one click, streamlining your workflow.


This plugin is perfect for design systems, brand guidelines, or any project requiring consistent color scales. It streamlines the color creation process while ensuring your palettes meet professional quality standards.

Elevate your design process with an intelligent color generation that combines creative freedom with technical precision.

plugins.name: Color cleaner: Merge similar colors & connect with variables
plugins.description:
About

Color Cleaner is a plugin designed to help streamline your Figma files not only by reducing the number of colors and minimizing subtle variations of the same shade, but also connecting them with variables.


How to use

Use the “Level of cleanup” slider to adjust how much cleanup is applied. Preview the changes in the box below and choose a setting that balances effectiveness. Typically, aim for a setting that is neither too soft to make a noticeable difference, nor too hard to avoid merging distinct colors.

Toggle the “Match with variables” checkbox if you want colors to be connected with available variables. When ready, click “Clean.” After a brief moment, the changes will be applied to the selected element.

plugins.name: design-tokens.io Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
This is the Figma plugin for design-tokens.io


design-tokens.io is the real-time hub for your Design Tokens.


Ensure design consistency across multiple brands, themes and projects.

Accelerate release cycles through seamless handoffs between designers and developers.

Built for agencies and enterprise design teams.


Consistency across all brands

Keep a single source of truth for all your Design Tokens. All your themes stay 100% interchangable, by default.


Seamless import & export

Import and export your Design Tokens as W3C-compliant JSON. Avoid vendor lock-in.


Real-time collaboration

Multiple users manage Design Tokens, themes and brands at the same time. No workflow bottlenecks, no data conflicts.


Bridge design and development

Designers sync their Design Tokens with Figma variables in real-time. Developers receive CSS/SASS variables. No manual handoffs necessary.



FAQs


What if I already use Figma Variables?

That’s fine! Our platform natively supports Figma Variables while protecting you from their limited scalability and interoperability. It acts as a single-source-of-truth for all your Design Tokens and integrates with all your tools, not just Figma.


I only use the free Figma plan. Will this work for me?

Yes! Our Figma plugin works with every Figma plan, even the free one. It lets you import your Design Tokens into Figma and sync your changes in real-time, no matter how many tokens, themes and brands you manage.


Why not use Tokens Studio?

Tokens Studio is great, but it is primarily a Figma plugin - intended to be used by Figma users from within Figma. It even stores all your Design Tokens inside Figma.

Our platform takes the opposite approach: It is a standalone, single-purpose data hub that lets your whole team collaborate on your Design Tokens and syncs them to all your tools, not just Figma.


We're already using Supernova. Is this compatible?

Absolutely! You can start using our platform in tandem with Supernova today, since Supernova will import your Design Tokens from Figma as usual. We're also working on a native Supernova hook that will make the process even more seamless!


Is the platform W3C-compliant?

Yes! Our platform ensures maximum interoperability with all your other tools by being fully compliant with the latest version of the W3C Design Tokens specification. You can seamlessly import and export Design Tokens as W3C DTCG JSON.


What's the learning curve for my team?

Our platform is reportedly much easier to use than comparable tools and was designed from the ground up to make managing and accessing Design Tokens as simple as possible.

You will be up and running in a matter of minutes. Watch demo

plugins.name: Auto Select
plugins.description:
Auto Select is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your workflow by providing advanced selection tools. With Auto Select, you can easily select objects by name and hierarchy, making it effortless to navigate and manipulate complex designs. Whether you're working on a small project or a large-scale design system, Auto Select is the perfect companion to enhance your productivity and creativity in Figma.


Key Features:


Select objects by name: Quickly find and select objects by entering their names.

Select parent and child layers: Navigate through the hierarchy of your design by selecting parent or child layers.

Undo selection: Easily undo selections to refine your choices.

Select all: Select all objects in your current Figma canvas with a single click.

Close plugin: Close the plugin window when you're done selecting objects.


You can select child layers of selected object and then parent layer of selected child layer .


How to Use:


Enter the name of the object you want to select in the input field.

Click on the "Select Object" button to select the object.

Use the other buttons to perform various selection actions, such as selecting all objects, selecting parent layers, selecting child layers, undoing selections, and closing the plugin.

Get Started with Auto Select today and take your Figma workflow to the next level!
plugins.tagline: "Effortless Selection, Seamless Design: Auto Select simplifies your Figma workflow."

plugins.name: Typography Style Guide Creator
plugins.description:
Typography Style Guide Creator is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers streamline their typography workflow by automatically generating text styles from existing designs. Stop manually recreating text styles and let this plugin do the heavy lifting.

With Typography Style Guide Creator, you can transform any frame containing text elements into a complete typography system that's integrated directly into your Figma styles. Simply select a frame with your text designs, run the plugin, and watch as your typography system comes to life.

Key Features


Instant Style Generation: Convert manually created text elements into reusable Figma text styles with one click

Smart Name Recognition: Uses your text layer names as style names for better organization

Duplicate Detection: Intelligently identifies and merges duplicate styles to keep your design system clean

Visual Style Preview: See all created styles in an intuitive interface before applying them

Seamless Integration: Styles are added directly to your Figma document's style library


How It Works


Select a Frame: Choose any frame containing your text elements

Name Your Layers: Ensure text layers have descriptive names (e.g., "Heading/H1", "Body/Regular")

Run the Plugin: Click "Create Styles" to generate your typography system

Done!: Your text styles are now available in your Figma document


Perfect For


Design teams establishing consistent typography systems

Designers converting existing designs into organized style guides

Design system maintainers looking to formalize typography rules

Anyone who wants to save time on manual style creation


Save Hours of Design Work

Typography Style Guide Creator eliminates the tedious process of manually creating and managing text styles. What would normally take hours can now be done in seconds, allowing you to focus on what matters most—designing great experiences.
plugins.tagline: Turn your text designs into organized typography styles with a single click

plugins.name: PSD Importer for Figma
plugins.description:
Import your PSD files directly into Figma. It preserves the design elements such as layer structure, text properties, and complex styles, offering a smooth transition from Photoshop to Figma.


There are 2 import methods.

  1. Import all layers with maximum compatibility.
  2. Import each layer is bitmap image.


While the plugin strives for high accuracy, some discrepancies may occur due to differences between Photoshop and Figma’s rendering engines - particularly with complex effects, blending modes, and certain layer styles. In cases where features can’t be translated, some layers may be imported as images.


Users can try the plugin with three free PSD imports, after which unlimited access is available through an $8/month subscription.
plugins.tagline: Easily import your PSD files in just a few clicks.

plugins.description:
Import Design Tokens JSON to Figma variables and Figma styles. Export Figma variables and styles to Design Tokens JSON. Use mode names to create groups for light mode, dark mode, and high contrast variants. It’s a great way to transfer colors, numbers, strings, shadows, and booleans to and from Figma to Pinwheel, or anywhere that can import Design Tokens Community Group formatted JSON.


What's Pinwheel? We’re glad you asked. It’s an amazing app for managing your design system, converting between color formats and color spaces, and automating color contrast testing. If you work with design systems, Pinwheel is for you.

plugins.name: AI Page Manager
plugins.description:
AI Page Manager is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your page management workflow. With this tool, you can effortlessly rename, add, delete, and reorder pages in your Figma file, all from a single, intuitive interface.


Key features:

1. Batch Rename: Quickly rename multiple pages at once.

2. Add Pages: Create new pages with custom names in just a few clicks.

3. Delete Pages: Remove unwanted pages easily and safely.

4. Reorder Pages: Drag and drop to rearrange your pages in any order you prefer.

5. Add Separators: Organise your pages with visual separators for better structure.

6. Refresh: Sync your plugin view with the latest changes in your Figma file.


How to use:

1. Open the plugin to see a list of all pages in your current Figma file.

2. To rename a page, simply type the new name in the input field next to the current page name.

3. To add a new page, click the "+" button and enter a name for your new page.

4. To delete a page, click the trash can icon next to the page you want to remove.

5. To reorder pages, drag and drop the pages into your desired sequence.

6. To add a separator, click the "Add Separator" button.

7. Once you've made your changes, click "Apply Changes" to update your Figma file.

8. Use the refresh button to sync the plugin with any external changes made to your file.


The AI Page Manager also includes a teaser for upcoming AI-powered features, hinting at future enhancements that will make your page management even more efficient.


Whether you're working on a small project or a complex design system with numerous pages, AI Page Manager helps you keep your Figma files organized and your workflow smooth. Say goodbye to tedious page management and hello to a more productive design process!
plugins.tagline: Easily rename, add, delete and reorder pages in your Figma file.
